service.name: Youth Allowance Student
service.description: Youth Allowance Student (YFST) is an income support payment for students aged 16-24 undertaking or intending to undertake an approved course of study which aims to: ensure eligible young people receive adequate levels of income while studying or training; encourage young people to choose further education or training over job search if they do not have sufficient skills to obtain long-term employment; and encourage young people to undertake a range of activities that will promote entry into employment. Some 15 year olds may qualify for Youth Allowance (YA) and some full-time students and Australian Apprentices continue to qualify for YA after they turn 25. Assistance for students or Australian Apprentices aged 25 years or over is generally provided under Austudy.
